title: Shift storefront theme to a blue-forward palette (reduce/remove pink/purple)

requirements.summary: Update global storefront theme tokens to emphasize blue tones, reduce/remove pink/purple hues, and maintain readable/accessible contrast in light and dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme tokens are adjusted to emphasize blue as the primary and reduce/remove any pink/purple-leaning tones (including in light and dark mode variables).
No prominent UI elements (section gradients, buttons, cards, badges, dividers) render with clearly pink/purple styling unless it is a very subtle, non-dominant accent.
Text and interactive components maintain accessible contrast (no low-contrast text on gradients/backgrounds introduced by the palette change).

file_operations.description: Adjust the OKLCH CSS variables (light and .dark) to shift neutrals away from purple hues (e.g., foreground/border/muted-foreground) and keep primary blue-forward; update any purple-leaning chart tokens to non-purple alternatives while preserving the playful/cartoonish feel and ensuring good contrast.
Align any global theme CSS variables (light and .dark) with the updated blue-forward palette so theming remains consistent if this file is used by the build; keep contrast and readability.

Review theme color token bindings to ensure the updated CSS variables map cleanly (no purple/pink hardcoding) and that alpha-enabled tokens (e.g., ring/primary/muted) still produce accessible contrast across common UI states.

requirements.summary: Replace explicit Tailwind purple/pink gradient usages in storefront sections with blue-forward gradients consistent with the updated theme.
acceptanceCriteria: Featured collection cards and other gradient-based UI elements no longer use purple/pink Tailwind classes (e.g., purple-*, fuchsia-*, pink-*), and are updated to blue-forward equivalents.
The updated gradients look consistent with the rest of the site theme (header/hero/products sections) and do not introduce new clashing colors.

file_operations.description: Replace the collection card gradient that currently uses purple Tailwind classes with a blue-forward gradient (e.g., blue/sky/cyan family) and ensure the sectionâ€™s gradients remain consistent with the global theme.

Update gradientMap entries that use pink/purple Tailwind classes (e.g., women/infants) to blue-forward gradients; verify category cards still feel playful and icons remain readable on the new gradients.
Update the highlight gradient that currently uses purple Tailwind classes to a blue-forward gradient, keeping consistent styling with other highlight cards and maintaining icon/text contrast.
